quest.name: When the Bough Wakes
journal: Unukalhai is anxious to act before the Warring Triad awaken.

Unukalhai warns that the Warring Triad are stirring, and insists that the time to move against them has come. Being the closest to awakening, the eikon known as Sephirot is to be your first target. Join Unukalhai on the Flagship, Azys Lla's main isle, and await the arrival of your fellow Scions.

You rendezvous with Unukalhai, and are joined by Y'shtola, Urianger, and Krile─the latter being the “talented individual” to whom Unukalhai alluded earlier. Having spared no effort in her preparations, the surviving Student of Baldesion swiftly discerns the only feasible way to proceed, and assigns herself the task of disabling Sephirot's shackles. Summon your Echo-blessed companions, and make ready to engage the wrathful god as he awakens from millennia of dream-bound servitude.

※Containment Bay S1T7 can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
You have felled the towering Sephirot. Make your way back to the Flagship.

You return to the Flagship, and share a brief moment of celebration with your companions. For the present, at least, your mission on Azys Lla is complete. Head back to the Rising Stones and speak with Unukalhai.

Back at the Rising Stones, Urianger compliments you on your victory, but advises you to marshal your strength before contemplating confronting the Warring Triad's two remaining eikons. Given the Garleans' appetite for Allagan technology, however, Unukalhai warns that you may not have the luxury of time. Tiring of the masked youth's portentous utterances, Krile then challenges Unukalhai to reveal his master's identity, but finds the boy wholly unwilling to eschew his veil of secrecy. Though you say nothing, you cannot help but share her misgivings regarding his true motivations...
objectives: Rendezvous with Unukalhai at the Flagship.
Confront Sephirot in Containment Bay S1T7.
Speak with Unukalhai at the Rising Stones.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: The time has come, Warrior of Light─we must move against the Warring Triad now, or suffer the consequences.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: The seal is cracked and the eikons stir. Should they be allowed to awaken and resume their titanic conflict, it will be alike to the coming of a second Calamity. You, Forename, represent our best hope of eliminating this threat.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: That said, the very act of entering the containment facility itself presents certain...unique challenges. So unique, in fact, that I struggled to locate an individual with the requisite talents to surmount them. Were it not for the impressively diverse connections of your fellow Scions, I might still be searching. Happily, however, they were able to furnish me with a suitable candidate.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Now, along with you and your Echo-blessed companions, all the pieces we need to proceed with this deadly game are arrayed upon the board. Victory hinges upon no less than the total destruction of the Warring Triad.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: But we must also ware the interference of those who covet the Allagans' primal-harnessing technology. I speak, of course, of the blindly grasping hand of the Garlean Empire and its fumbling agents.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: The ignorant meddling of the Empire will serve only to hasten the eikons' awakening, and it is my master's desire that the Triad be dispatched before imperial forces delve too deeply.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Being the nearest to wakefulness, the eikon Sephirot shall be your first adversary. Make your preparations, and join me on the Flagship in Azys Lla. We shall speak further there.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Of the Warring Triad, Sephirot's slumber is the most fitful. Join me on Azys Lla's central isle as soon as you are able, and we shall attend to his destruction first.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: This is the place, Warrior of Light. Here we will find the containment facility wherein entities of incalculable power lie chained, their fathomless energies siphoned away by Allagan devices.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: As I warned you, Sephirot poses the most immediate threat─his dreaming mind drifts perilously close to consciousness. Thus must his destruction be our first concern.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Your fellow Scions will be joining us anon, accompanied by the uniquely talented individual of whom I spoke. From what I gather, the two of you are already well acquainted.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Let us continue inside, and wait before the doors to the containment facility.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: You've not been waiting long, I trust? We are eager to lend whatever cooperation we may to your mission, Forename.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: It is an honor to meet you at last. As I know of only one other Miqo'te Scion, you must be Archon Y'shtola...meaning your diminutive companion is Mistress Krile of the Students of Baldesion. Correct?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Diminutive? Perhaps there has been some mistake. I assumed it was for my knowledge and not my stature that you requested my assistance.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Ahem. The mistake is mine. My apologies if I have given offense. Mayhap it would be best if we proceeded directly to the matter of our objectives.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Your adversary is the eikon Sephirot of the Warring Triad, otherwise known by the historians of Allag as “the Fiend.” He was once the patron deity to a tribe of treelike beings native to Meracydia, but was subdued by the Allagan Empire after a lengthy war of attrition.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: After his defeat, he was imprisoned for use as a source of power. Even now, Sephirot is neither truly living nor dead─his mind bound in a dream while his body's energies are harnessed by Allagan technologies.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: The explanation for his failure to dissipate into aether lies in his restraints. These ingenious devices serve not only to bind him but to continuously regenerate his corporeal form.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Meaning it will be all but impossible to banish him while said restraints are in place, yes? Remove them, however, and we risk allowing an unfathomably powerful─and doubtless vengeful─eikon to run rampant.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: It seems we have no choice but to divide our forces: one team must locate the controls to Sephirot's shackles and disable them, while the other stands ready to destroy him at the moment of his awakening.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: ...A most succinct assessment, Mistress Krile. While I was aware that the Echo provided you with uncanny insight, I did not expect you to intuit the core of my strategy quite so swiftly.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Ha! If only my gift offered such detailed analysis─which is to say, it doesn't. I merely took it upon myself to learn as much about the Triad's imprisonment as I could before coming here. It will be Forename and I, after all, who enter the eikon's den.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Indeed. Given the nature of our adversary, none save those under the aegis of the Echo should be permitted to enter the containment facility. The risk of primal influence is too great.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Well, that's that settled, then. I will disable the restraints, and Forename and herhis gifted adventurer friends will welcome Sephirot back into the waking world. Better that than the other way around, I'd say, considering our respective fields of expertise─and, of course, my diminutive stature.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text:
Right.
It's time I had a little “chat” with the doorkeeper over there...

dialogue.name: VERIFICATIONSYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> Activating verification systems. Lifting access restriction to Triad Control...

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: I had no idea the Baldesion curriculum was so comprehensive. When we locate the controls for Sephirot's restraints, I shall gladly leave their operation to you.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: When “we” locate the controls? Mayhap my words were unclear. Only those blessed with the Echo may safely enter the facility.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Your concern for my sanity is touching─but unnecessary. Suffice it to say, I am in no danger of falling under the eikon's sway.

dialogue.name: VERIFICATIONSYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> <bloop> WARNING! Verification systems detect multiple unauthorized vessels entering restricted airspace. Security systems engaging intruders.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text:
The Garleans...
Come, Urianger, we must keep the imperials occupied.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: We too should be on our way. Gods...I would be lying if I said I wasn't slightly terrified... But I can't very well leave every deadly task to you Scions.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: According to the histories, Sephirot was immense in both size and strength─mighty enough to rout even the implacable armies of the Allagans, and that more than once. To cut a long story short, we have to get this right.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I shall do my best not to wake the eikon up too much. As my grandfather always used to say of certain little monsters: “Get them up and get them moving while their brains are still abed.”

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Sephirot's power beggars belief. But a hero of your standing surely needs no reminding of the dangers of underestimating such an adversary.

dialogue.name: VERIFICATIONSYSTEM
dialogue.text:
<blip> Activating verification systems...
Identification code accepted. Triad Control clearance granted.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text:
You did it! I've seen you in action before, but never against anything that big...
My legs kept telling me to run, but I just couldn't tear myself away! I don't think I blinked once during the whole battle!

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text:
A hero, tried and true.
If only I had possessed such strength...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Y'shtola? This is Krile. Eikon eliminated! Oh, if only you could have seen it... Forename gave Sephirot the mother of all rude awakenings!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: And your distraction was perfect! We encountered not a single imperial soldier. Hm? Yes. Understood. Let's swap tales at the Rising Stones, then!

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: On our path to the control chamber, we discovered a number of dormant thralls. It would seem the machines that preserve their forms also hold them in a state of torpor. We need not fear them summoning their deity anew.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: In short, our work here is done─for the present, at least. Let's go home, shall we?

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: Your senses are sharp, young one.

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: I am Regula van Hydrus, legatus of the VIth Legion...and it would seem that that damnable woman and her accomplice have led me a merry dance through the thickest of this infernal island's defenses. To think that I pursued them. <sigh> I shall withdraw for now, my lesson learnt.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: I doubt it. You Garleans never learn. You covet the means to enslave primals─but in your headlong dash to control that which you do not understand, you show less wisdom than the very beast tribes that summoned them!

dialogue.name: REGULAVANHYDRUS
dialogue.text: I have no interest in crossing blades with children. Live, grow strong, and mayhap one day you will warrant my attention.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I looked back and you weren't there. Did something happen?

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Naught of consequence. I mistook a shadow for a man.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Just what are you hiding beneath that mask of yours? Hmmm... A longing for hope. An appetite for power. A lingering sense of regret.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: And do I detect a desire to test your strength against a certain hero...?

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: ...Is that what your gifts tell you?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: No, those were just wild guesses. But I wonder if some few of my words didn't strike close to the mark.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: ...Or mayhap more than a few.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Be at ease, Unukalhai─I have no supernatural ability to read minds. The Echo simply allows me to comprehend, regardless of language, that which a fellow being would have me know. You need not mask your heart as you do your countenance.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: That was a performance, then? A ruse to uncover my true nature? I see I shall have to keep my wits about me...

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: So, Warrior of Light, how did it feel to strike down so great a foe? You must tell me more of the experience once our meeting with your colleagues is concluded...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Through thine all-surpassing skill at arms do we now take our first step in ridding this star of the Warring Triad's baleful presence. And in such wise do we lessen the burden bequeathed unto us by the vainglory of Allag.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Know, however, that the two eikons which remain are thought equal in might to Sephirot...and may yet exceed him. Ere thou proceed, I would counsel thee to marshal thy strength, and give careful thought to thy preparation.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: Assuming the Garleans afford us the luxury of time. Even now, they grasp for the means to dominate primals, blind to the technology's potential for calamity.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: My master taught me that the entity known as Sephirot was this world's first sacred tree, elevated to godhood by the belief of its worshipers. There is no power more fearsome than that born of unconditional faith and unbending ideal.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: 'Tis plain your master found in you a willing student. Tell me, was it he who taught you of Allagan technology's “potential for calamity,” or are those your own words?

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: 'Twas but a figure of speech, nothing more.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: When last we met, I thought I caught a glimpse of the boy behind the mask. ...But it would seem your defenses are firmly back in place.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Must you persist with this infuriating veil of secrecy? I for one would very much like to know who this “master” of yours is─amongst other things.

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: As long as our purposes align, what matter my affiliation?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: It matters a great deal. I do not ask out of idle curiosity─if we are to fight as comrades, we need to be able to trust each other.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text:
On which note, I should apologize for my earlier trickery. It was merely an attempt to get to the heart of an enigmatic companion.
Truth be told, I was rather glad you reacted as you did. No person of your age has any business being calm and aloof all of the time, much as you might wish to be.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Anyway, we had best be off. Do send word if there are any further developments!

dialogue.name: UNUKALHAI
dialogue.text: A “companion” now, am I?

obj.n: As Goes Light, So Goes Darkness
